data.title: Line-final cursor position incorrect with Unicode combining characters 0x300 - 0x363
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-insider
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write text with a Unicode combining character
2. Try to move the cursor to the end of the line, it jumps back to the beginning

![](http://i.imgur.com/UP3rHt1.gif)

data.title: .vscode folder for empty text document?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create new text document on desktop and open with vscode
2. now i have a hidden .vscode folder with a database on my desktop?

is there anyway to not create this file and folder unless there is a project? or at least some parse-able data?
is there a way to centralize or disable this cache?

thanks

data.title: Don't auto-add closing quotes in HTML outside tags

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When entering characters in HTML, VS Code will auto-close all quotes.

This seems like sensible behaviour within a tag, but outside tags (i.e. in copy) a single-quote could easily be being used as an apostrophe.

data.title: There is no search history
data.body:
Can't easily redo previous search, which is very annoying and decreases productivity.
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press Shift+Cmd+F
2. Search for something
3. Search for another thing
4. Press UP key (or Cmd+Z or whatever)

Expected: Show previous search term, like all other editors
Result: Nothing happens

VS Code:
![VS Code Search Example](https://s31.postimg.org/6th4ds8hn/search-code.gif)

Atom:
![Atom Search Example](https://s31.postimg.org/4q6p648or/search-atom.gif)

data.title: Consider to change development process
data.body:
Follow up discussion on:
- PR https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/5443#issuecomment-211401340
- Nightly builds https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5453

Current development process:
- developers commit directly into `master`
- you cannot be 100% sure that you can build `master`.
- there are no way to setup Nightly Builds, because there are huge chance that build can be broken in master.
- it happened to me two times already (for my 2 days experience with VSCode). When I pulled master and could not use it, because in first time there were some issues with runtime (which could be found with integration test) and second time a build issue.
- It is just my assumption that because of this workflow you can lose interest of some contributors, don't think that most folks will deal with it.

My suggestion:
- Personally I believe all changes needs to be made with Code Reviews. But my ask to at least work through PR and only merge when build is green.

Microsoft now has plenty Open Source projects, I believe most of them (if not all) are using Pull Request model with Code Reviews. Please talk to @shanselman, ASP.NET team or dotnet core team to learn from their experience.

/cc @jrieken

data.title: Why is the version 1.0 in German?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

The new version is in German???

data.title: let's avoid cycling service dependencies

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: We have a couple of cycling dependencies between services, like `KeybindingService` depends on `MessageService` and vice versa. Such dependencies are undesirable and we should strive to remove them/not have them in the first place. Let's collection cycling dependencies first and then come up with a plan on how to get rid of them.

data.title: don't use setter injection
data.body: It seems the workbench has established a pattern of [setter-injection](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/browser/workbench.ts#L364) for spreading the instantiation service. Either convince me of why that is good or use constructor injection.

data.title: Add support to configure the UI Language through menu entries

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: all

Currently users have to edit a json file. We should provide menu entries for this.

data.title: uninstall outdated extension with correct version
data.body:
This PR solves #4970 . It's caused by misuse of extension version number:
1. We put version number in Extension's folder name, so it's out of date.
2. Except "Show installed extensions", we'll fetch the latest extension info from VSO marketplace to generate the extension list view, so the extension version we see in the list view is actually the latest one
3. When we click Uninstall button from the extension list view, we are using the version number we fetched from VSO marketplace to locate the extension folder on disk, that's why we can't find the extension folder on disk.

data.title: suggest give a plugin for user-defined snippets

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0
- OS Version:win7

I hope have a plugin like bootstrap-3-snippets, we can use it quote myself snippets from localhost or server(for example github).

data.title: JSON completion extensibility
data.body:
I love how VS Code completes e.g. npm library names when editing `package.json`, that's really great!
However could this be more pluggable, so a vscode extension could provide own `IJSONWorkerContribution`? I'd be interested in implementing one similar to NPM handler.

data.title: Go to Definition doesn't work in Diff View
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Mac OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any git repository
2. Make changes to a file
3. Navigate to Git pane and pick the changed file
4. On the left side pane, right click on any function as below
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/14636789/1de4cbde-0660-11e6-8c5f-e7d4aa8a4364.png)
5. `Go to Definition` doesn't work, nothing happens. While if you do the same thing on the right side pane, it works as charm.

We know that the code is already changed and Intellisense won't work for original version (the left side one), should we hide the context menu instead of confusing users with the not-working `Got to Definition` or `Peek Definition`?

data.title: Crash when copying large amounts of data to clipboard
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 v1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a large file (35MB or more).
2. Select All (Ctrl+A)
3. Copy to clipboard (Ctrl+C)

The file opens and you can navigate very quickly. That works great, but trying to copy the whole file to clipboard makes the app crash. I am not sure there are any logs that I can pull to help diagnose the problem.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15444756/14633557/c31800da-05e3-11e6-84ef-a34fa979baea.png)

data.title: Freeze up after leaving running overnight
data.body:
Version 0.10.11
Commit f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049
Date 2016-03-11T16:19:03.130Z
Shell 0.35.6
Renderer 45.0.2454.85
Node 4.1.1
Using the C++ extensions

Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Leave VS Code running overnight with laptop lid shut
2. When I return the next morning, it's unresponsive and eventually prompts me to close it

It's not the only program that has this issue when I come back in the mornings (Toggl and Slack sometimes do too, but that requires a kill -9 to fix!). Other apps, such as Thunderbird and Firefox, do not have this problem.

I've also noticed that over time the editor gets slower and slower, eventually grinding to a halt. Perhaps this is just the manifestation of that overnight? Perhaps some kind of leak, be it tasks or memory?

data.title: How to index functions in vscode?
data.body: We can index functions by Ctrl + R in sublime text,But I'm not found this function in vscode

data.title: Extension management in viewlet
data.body:
Alternative to #5074

To experiment with this:

```
git checkout -b extension-viewlet master
git pull --no-rebase https://github.com/joaomoreno/vscode.git extension-viewlet
```
